channel.title: CVE Feed for Qualcomm, Inc. -- Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Qualcomm, Inc. -- Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android

item.title: CVE-2018-11302|2024-08-05T08:01:52.894Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, lack of check of input received from userspace before copying into buffer can lead to potential array overflow in WLAN.

item.title: CVE-2018-5895|2024-08-05T05:47:55.991Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Buffer over-read may happen in wma_process_utf_event() due to improper buffer length validation before writing into param_buf->num_wow_packet_buffer in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5832|2024-08-05T05:47:55.932Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Due to a race condition in a camera driver ioctl handler in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, a Use After Free condition can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-11297|2024-08-05T08:01:52.815Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, a buffer over-read can occur In the WMA NDP event handler functions due to lack of validation of input value event_info which is received from FW.

item.title: CVE-2018-3582|2024-08-05T04:50:30.428Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Buffer overflow can occur due to improper input validation in multiple WMA event handler functions in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-3598|2024-08-05T04:50:30.316Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, insufficient validation of parameters from userspace in the camera driver can lead to information leak and out-of-bounds access.

item.title: CVE-2018-5843|2024-08-05T05:47:56.171Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the function wma_pdev_div_info_evt_handler() in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel, there is no upper bound check on the value event->num_chains_valid received from firmware which can lead to a buffer overwrite of the fixed size chain_rssi_result structure.

item.title: CVE-2018-5853|2024-08-05T05:47:56.107Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: A race condition exists in a driver in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-05-05 potentially leading to a use-after-free condition.

item.title: CVE-2018-11294|2024-08-05T08:01:53.044Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, WLAN handler indication from the firmware gets the information for 4 access categories. While processing this information only the first 3 AC information is copied due to the improper conditional logic used to compare with the max number of categories.

item.title: CVE-2018-3596|2024-08-05T04:50:30.416Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, legacy code vulnerable after migration has been removed.

item.title: CVE-2018-3578|2024-08-05T04:50:29.502Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Type mismatch for ie_len can cause the WLAN driver to allocate less memory on the heap due to implicit casting leading to a heap buffer overflow in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5851|2024-08-05T05:47:55.989Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Buffer over flow can occur while processing a HTT_T2H_MSG_TYPE_TX_COMPL_IND message with an out-of-range num_msdus value in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11293|2024-08-05T08:01:52.935Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, in wma_ndp_confirm_event_handler and wma_ndp_indication_event_handler, ndp_cfg len and num_ndp_app_info is from fw. If they are not checked, it may cause buffer over-read once the value is too large.

item.title: CVE-2018-5834|2024-08-05T05:47:55.754Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_vendor_scan(), a buffer overwrite can potentially occur in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5889|2024-08-05T05:47:55.974Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing a compressed kernel image, a buffer overflow can occur in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5899|2024-08-05T05:47:56.114Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, whenever TDLS connection is setup, we are freeing the netbuf in ol_tx_completion_handler and after that, we are accessing it in NBUF_UPDATE_TX_PKT_COUNT causing a use after free.

item.title: CVE-2018-5873|2024-08-05T05:47:55.947Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: An issue was discovered in the __ns_get_path function in fs/nsfs.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11. Due to a race condition when accessing files, a Use After Free condition can occur. This also affects all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5858|2024-08-05T05:47:55.914Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the audio debugfs in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, out of bounds access can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-3562|2024-08-05T04:50:30.156Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Buffer over -read can occur while processing a FILS authentication frame in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5857|2024-08-05T05:47:55.953Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the WCD CPE codec, a Use After Free condition can occur in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11278|2024-08-05T08:01:52.883Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, Venus HW searches for start code when decoding input bit stream buffers. If start code is not found in entire buffer, there is over-fetch beyond allocation length. This leads to page fault.

item.title: CVE-2018-11274|2024-08-05T08:01:52.881Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, buffer overflow may occur when payload size is extremely large.

item.title: CVE-2018-11262|2024-08-05T08:01:52.861Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel while trying to find out total number of partition via a non zero check, there could be possibility where the 'TotalPart' could cross 'GptHeader->MaxPtCnt' and which could result in OOB write in patching GPT.

item.title: CVE-2018-3599|2024-08-05T04:50:30.372Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, while notifying a DCI client, a Use After Free condition can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-3570|2024-08-05T04:50:30.185Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the cpuidle driver in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel, the list_for_each macro was not used correctly which could lead to an untrusted pointer dereference.

item.title: CVE-2018-5872|2024-08-05T05:47:55.935Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While parsing over-the-air information elements in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, the use of an out-of-range pointer offset can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-3580|2024-08-05T04:50:28.933Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Stack-based buffer overflow can occur In the WLAN driver if the pmkid_count value is larger than the PMKIDCache size in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5846|2024-08-05T05:47:55.917Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: A Use After Free condition can occur in the IPA driver whenever the IPA IOCTLs IPA_IOC_NOTIFY_WAN_UPSTREAM_ROUTE_ADD/IPA_IOC_NOTIFY_WAN_UPSTREAM_ROUTE_DEL/IPA_IOC_NOTIFY_WAN_EMBMS_CONNECTED are called in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5836|2024-08-05T05:47:55.977Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In wma_nan_rsp_event_handler() in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, the data_len value is received from firmware and not properly validated which could potentially lead to an out-of-bounds access.

item.title: CVE-2018-5849|2024-08-05T05:47:55.929Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Due to a race condition in the QTEECOM driver in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel, when more than one HLOS client loads the same TA, a Use After Free condition can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5844|2024-08-05T05:47:55.956Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the video driver function set_output_buffers(), binfo can be accessed after being freed in a failure scenario in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11263|2024-08-05T08:01:52.844Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all Android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel, radio_id is received from the FW and is used to access the buffer to copy the radio stats received for each radio from FW. If the radio_id received from the FW is greater than or equal to maximum, an OOB write will occur. On supported Google Pixel and Nexus devices, this has been addressed in security patch level 2018-08-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5828|2024-08-05T05:47:55.929Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, in function wma_extscan_start_stop_event_handler(), vdev_id comes from the variable event from firmware and is not properly validated potentially leading to a buffer overwrite.

item.title: CVE-2018-3597|2024-08-05T04:50:30.176Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the ADSP RPC driver in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, an arbitrary kernel write can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5863|2024-08-05T05:47:56.109Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: If userspace provides a too-large WPA RSN IE length in wlan_hdd_cfg80211_set_ie(), a buffer overflow occurs in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11280|2024-08-05T08:01:52.857Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, while processing user-space there is no size validation of the NAT entry input. If the user input size of the NAT entry is greater than the max allowed size, memory exhaustion will occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5886|2024-08-05T05:47:55.927Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: A pointer in an ADSPRPC command is not properly validated in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android), which can lead to kernel memory being accessed.

item.title: CVE-2018-5829|2024-08-05T05:47:55.914Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In wlan_hdd_cfg80211_set_privacy_ibss() in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, a buffer over-read can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5840|2024-08-05T05:47:55.969Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input can occur during the DRM SDE driver initialization sequence in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11270|2024-08-05T08:01:52.815Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, memory allocated with devm_kzalloc is automatically released by the kernel if the probe function fails with an error code. This may result in data corruption.

item.title: CVE-2018-3569|2024-08-05T04:50:30.415Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: A buffer over-read can occur during a fast initial link setup (FILS) connection in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5827|2024-08-05T05:47:55.921Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in WLAN while processing an extscan hotlist event.

item.title: CVE-2018-11304|2024-08-05T08:01:52.874Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Possible buffer overflow in msm_adsp_stream_callback_put due to lack of input validation of user-provided data that leads to integer overflow in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11295|2024-08-05T08:01:52.890Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, WMA handler carries a fixed event data from the firmware to the host . If the length and anqp length from this event data exceeds the max length, an OOB write would happen.

item.title: CVE-2018-5830|2024-08-05T05:47:55.941Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing the HTT_T2H_MSG_TYPE_MGMT_TX_COMPL_IND message, a buffer overflow can potentially occur in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-3564|2024-08-05T04:50:29.267Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the FastRPC driver in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, a Use After Free condition can occur when mapping on the remote processor fails.

item.title: CVE-2018-3571|2024-08-05T04:50:29.055Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the KGSL driver in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel, a Use After Free condition can occur when printing information about sparse memory allocations

item.title: CVE-2018-3586|2024-08-05T04:50:30.399Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: An integer overflow to buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the ADSPRPC heap manager in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5822|2024-08-05T05:47:55.299Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, compromised WLAN FW can potentially cause a buffer overwrite.

item.title: CVE-2018-5847|2024-08-05T05:47:55.905Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Early or late retirement of rotation requests can result in a Use After Free condition in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-3574|2024-08-05T04:50:30.174Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, userspace can request ION cache maintenance on a secure ION buffer for which the ION_FLAG_SECURE ion flag is not set and cause the kernel to attempt to perform cache maintenance on memory which does not belong to HLOS.

item.title: CVE-2018-3573|2024-08-05T04:50:30.223Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, while relocating kernel images with a specially crafted boot image, an out of bounds access can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-3584|2024-08-05T04:50:28.954Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, a Use After Free condition can occur in the function rmnet_usb_ctrl_init().

item.title: CVE-2018-11298|2024-08-05T08:01:52.914Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, while processing SET_PASSPOINT_LIST vendor command HDD does not make sure that the realm string that gets passed by upper-layer is NULL terminated. This may lead to buffer overflow as strlen is used to get realm string length to construct the PASSPOINT WMA command.

item.title: CVE-2018-3572|2024-08-05T04:50:30.331Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing a DSP buffer in an audio driver's event handler, an index of a buffer is not checked before accessing the buffer in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-3567|2024-08-05T04:50:30.171Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in WLAN while processing the HTT_T2H_MSG_TYPE_PEER_MAP or HTT_T2H_MSG_TYPE_PEER_UNMAP messages.

item.title: CVE-2018-5848|2024-08-05T05:47:55.911Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the function wmi_set_ie(), the length validation code does not handle unsigned integer overflow properly. As a result, a large value of the 'ie_len' argument can cause a buffer overflow in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-3579|2024-08-05T04:50:28.963Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the WLAN driver in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel, event->num_entries_in_page is a value received from firmware that is not properly validated which can lead to a buffer over-read

item.title: CVE-2018-11265|2024-08-05T08:01:52.876Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, possible buffer overflow while incrementing the log_buf of type uint64_t in memcpy function, since the log_buf pointer can access the memory beyond the size to store the data after pointer increment.

item.title: CVE-2018-11281|2024-08-05T08:01:52.814Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, while calling IPA_IOC_MDFY_RT_RULE IPA IOCTL, header entry is not checked before use. If IPA_IOC_MDFY_RT_RULE IOCTL called for header entries formerly deleted, a Use after free condition will occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5855|2024-08-05T05:47:55.904Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While padding or shrinking a nested wmi packet in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, a buffer over-read can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5898|2024-08-05T05:47:56.117Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Integer overflow can occur in msm_pcm_adsp_stream_cmd_put() function if the user supplied data "param_length" goes beyond certain limit in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-3581|2024-08-05T04:50:30.180Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the WLAN driver in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel, a buffer overwrite can occur if the vdev_id received from firmware is larger than max_bssid.

item.title: CVE-2018-11296|2024-08-05T08:01:52.863Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, while processing a message from firmware in WLAN handler, a buffer overwrite can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5831|2024-08-05T05:47:55.796Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the KGSL driver in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, a reference counting error can lead to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2018-5826|2024-08-05T05:47:55.325Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, due to a race condition, a Use After Free condition can occur in the WLAN driver.

item.title: CVE-2018-5823|2024-08-05T05:47:55.985Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, improper buffer length validation in extscan hotlist event can lead to potential buffer overflow.

item.title: CVE-2018-3587|2024-08-05T04:50:30.436Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In a firmware memory dump feature in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android), a Use After Free condition can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-3563|2024-08-05T04:50:30.391Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, untrusted pointer dereference in apr_cb_func can lead to an arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2018-5859|2024-08-05T05:47:56.118Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Due to a race condition in the MDSS MDP driver in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, a Use After Free condition can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-3565|2024-08-05T04:50:29.540Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While sending a probe request indication in lim_send_sme_probe_req_ind() in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel, a buffer overflow can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5887|2024-08-05T05:47:55.964Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing the USB StrSerialDescriptor array, an array index out of bounds can occur in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-3568|2024-08-05T04:50:30.351Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, in __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_vendor_scan(), a buffer overwrite can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5896|2024-08-05T05:47:56.192Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, kernel panic may happen due to out-of-bound read, caused by not checking source buffer length against length of packet stream to be copied.

item.title: CVE-2018-5862|2024-08-05T05:47:55.805Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_vendor_scan() in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, when SCAN_SSIDS and QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_SCAN_FREQUENCIES are parsed, a buffer overwrite can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5893|2024-08-05T05:47:55.971Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing a message from firmware in htt_t2h_msg_handler_fast() in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05, a buffer overwrite can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5835|2024-08-05T05:47:55.894Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: If the seq_len is greater then CSR_MAX_RSC_LEN, a buffer overflow in __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_add_key() may occur when copying keyRSC in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5865|2024-08-05T05:47:55.923Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing a debug log event from firmware in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, an integer underflow and/or buffer over-read can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5854|2024-08-05T05:47:55.864Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: A stack-based buffer overflow can occur in fastboot from all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-3577|2024-08-05T04:50:30.417Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing fragments, when the fragment count becomes very large, an integer overflow leading to a buffer overflow can occur in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5907|2024-08-05T05:47:56.163Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: Possible buffer overflow in msm_adsp_stream_callback_put due to lack of input validation of user-provided data that leads to integer overflow in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5890|2024-08-05T05:47:55.920Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: If the fdt_totalsize is reported as 0 for the current device tree, it bypasses an error check for a valid device tree in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5850|2024-08-05T05:47:55.916Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the function csr_update_fils_params_rso(), insufficient validation on a key length can result in an integer underflow leading to a buffer overflow in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-11301|2024-08-05T08:01:52.889Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, lack of check on buffer length while processing debug log event from firmware can lead to an integer overflow.

item.title: CVE-2018-5842|2024-08-05T05:47:55.967Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: An arbitrary address write can occur if a compromised WLAN firmware sends incorrect data to WLAN driver in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-3576|2024-08-05T04:50:30.357Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: improper validation of array index in WiFi driver function sapInterferenceRssiCount() leads to array out-of-bounds access in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5824|2024-08-05T05:47:55.356Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, while processing HTT_T2H_MSG_TYPE_RX_FLUSH or HTT_T2H_MSG_TYPE_RX_PN_IND messages, a buffer overflow can occur if the tid value obtained from the firmware is out of range.

item.title: CVE-2018-5841|2024-08-05T05:47:56.042Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: dcc_curr_list is initialized with a default invalid value that is expected to be programmed by the user through a sysfs node which could lead to an invalid access in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5821|2024-08-05T05:47:55.878Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, in function wma_wow_wakeup_host_event(), wake_info->vdev_id is received from FW and is used directly as array index to access wma->interfaces whose max index should be (max_bssid-1). If wake_info->vdev_id is greater than or equal to max_bssid, an out-of-bounds read occurs.

item.title: CVE-2018-5864|2024-08-05T05:47:55.834Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing a WMI_APFIND event in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, a buffer over-read and information leak can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-11299|2024-08-05T08:01:52.820Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, when WLAN FW has not filled the vdev id correctly in stats events then WLAN host driver tries to access interface array without proper bound check which can lead to invalid memory access and as a side effect kernel panic or page fault.

item.title: CVE-2018-5825|2024-08-05T05:47:55.913Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, in the kernel IPA driver, a Use After Free condition can occur.

item.title: CVE-2018-5888|2024-08-05T05:47:55.982Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While processing the system path, an out of bounds access can occur in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-5860|2024-08-05T05:47:55.972Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In the MDSS driver in all Android releases(Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the Linux kernel, a data structure may be used without being initialized correctly.

item.title: CVE-2018-5897|2024-08-05T05:47:56.160Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: While reading the data from buffer in dci_process_ctrl_status() there can be buffer over-read problem if the len is not checked correctly in Android releases from CAF using the linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-06-05.

item.title: CVE-2018-3566|2024-08-05T04:50:29.259Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, a buffer overwrite may occur in ProcSetReqInternal() due to missing length check.

item.title: CVE-2018-11276|2024-08-05T08:01:52.872Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, double free of memory allocation is possible in Kernel when it explicitly tries to free that memory on driver probe failure, since memory allocated is automatically freed on probe.

item.title: CVE-2018-5845|2024-08-05T05:47:56.118Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: A race condition in drm_atomic_nonblocking_commit() in the display driver can potentially lead to a Use After Free scenario in all Android releases from CAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the Linux Kernel.

item.title: CVE-2018-5820|2024-08-05T05:47:55.873Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In Qualcomm Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel before security patch level 2018-04-05, in the function wma_tbttoffset_update_event_handler(), a parameter received from firmware is used to allocate memory for a local buffer and is not properly validated. This can potentially result in an integer overflow subsequently leading to a heap overwrite.

item.title: CVE-2018-11275|2024-08-05T08:01:52.905Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- android%20for%20msm%2C%20firefox%20os%20for%20msm%2C%20qrd%20android
item.description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, when flashing image using FastbootLib if size is not divisible by block size, information leak occurs.
